p: Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy (FTIR) is one of the most widely used techniques for the identification of chemical constituents and the elucidation of structural compounds. It has been used as a main method for identifying medicines in many countries [ 11]. FTIR analysis offers rapid fingerprint screening of the plant extracts [ 12]. Asokkumar et al. [ 12] indicated the application of FTIR in profiling natural herbs, including Solanum torvum, Phyllanthus amarus, Phyllanthus maderaspatensis, and Senna auriculata. In addition, Nagarajan et al. [ 11] carried out an FTIR study to detect the active functional groups present in garlic powder ( Allium sativum).
